channel.title: anditriathlon
channel.description: anditriathlon is andilab's initiative for sharing passion for triathlon and promoting healthy lifestyle.

item.title: Mallorca 70.3 (ed 2019) my 2nd time and Kasia debut
item.description:
This was tough but greate race! A bit improved PB at 70.3, and shaved 1h 10 minutes year to year on Mallorca 70.3 . First time swam sub 30 minutes on half ironman, very hard pushed bike leg with NP 231W, and still ready to run quite fast - avg pace 04:27min/km.

BIG KUDOS goes to Kasia Hutny (from Activity Szko≈Ça P≈Çywania) who completed that tough race as her first Ironman 70.3! Well done you Kasia!

Wy≈õwietl ten post na Instagramie.

item.title: andi rental - premium equipment rental
item.description:
2018 we decided to make great bikes available to triathlets who want to do a test ride before purchasing the bike or just want to have fun during their competitions using ulitmate gear.

*andi rental *offers premium equipment‚Äôs rental for your race without need to buy it

Check current offer and pricing:

http://andilabs.com/andirental/

item.title: My first Ironman - Ironman Hamburg 2017
item.description:
13 August 2017 I finished my first triathlon on the distance of 140.6 miles.

Ironman triathlon is combination of 3.8km (2.4 mile) swim, 180.25km (112 mile) bike and 42.2km (26.22 mile) run. Exactly in this order, followed directly one by another.

It was tough experience, but definitely the one really worth hard work and commitment.

SWIM - 1:10

Swim happend in Hamburger Binnen Alster and Alster, which is lovely lake in center of the city. Below you can see photo of Binnen Alster by night.

Below video from the swimming start.

Start of swim part #ironmanhamburg

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Aug 13, 2017 at 11:14pm PDT

After swim part in T1 I consumed:

  • half of banana
  • one powerbar apple gel with caffeine

BIKE - 05:42

The bike course was a two looped course. The vertical total climb was approx. 1.000m (approx.. 500m per loop). I really enjoyed the ride. Average of 32kmph is OK. I ate and drink a lot on bike.

While bike leg I consumed:

  • 60% of 590ml (20oz) mixture of 6 agisko gels and 2 powerbar green apple gels with caffeine
  • two toast bread sandwiches with butter and ham working extremly good for my stomach as some diversity to the diet based on gels and isotonic
  • about 2 liters of isopower from powergym
  • about 0.5L water
  • two powerbar energize bars

RUN - 04:36

At the photo me after first out of 4 loops.

Till 20k I was estimated to finish the race in about 10:30h Yeah men, but marathon is about some 42k üòÇ

Since 24k to 37k I was mostly walking. Legs just stopped to work with me, and were not intrested in any cooperation. Even fuckin Galloway was not a choice. Very humiliating expirience. Last time I had to walk was 2016 on marathon, but it happend because of contusion.

Never expirienced need of walk in any of 70.3 triathlons. Yeah men‚Ä¶ but this is an IRONMAN. I manage to force myself for last kilometers to run, and it worked again. This was a miracle.

Some questions to consider:

  • Maybe I pushed little too hard on bike? Although avg of 32kmph does not sounds crazy fast.
  • Maybe more cushioned shoes will work better? Choose clayton2 from hoka one one instead of more cushioned cliftons.
  • Maybe some better running technique? stronger core?
  • Probbably none of this would make signiffciant difference. I was not right prepared in terms of endurance. Too little long brick sessions.

Hopefully next year I come back to Hamburg for a revange!

This year running a marathon took me really loooong 4:36 hours

While run part I consumed:

  • about 4 powerbar gels, 1 agisko gel
  • drunk water
  • drunk cola
  • ate some orange and bannana

Average pace (min/km) of each of 5k splits:

  • 04:54
  • 05:25
  • 05:46
  • 06:13
  • 06:53
  • 08:39
  • 08:57
  • 07:18

11:43:54 - I done it!

After 11:43:54 I reached the finish line.

Ironman debut done. A bit of disappointment with my performance still in my heart. Learned an Ironman the hard way.

Still in love with swim, bike and run üèäüö¥üèÉ

Your first Ironman should be about fun and main goal ‚Äúcomplete‚Äù rather than ‚Äúcompete‚Äù.

Don‚Äôt plan your time goals. Just enjoy the moment!

Big THANKS !

last but not least I would like to say THANK YOU to few people supporting me on the way to becoming an Ironman.

Kasia

My wonderful grilfriend (btw my fianc√©e now üòç got engaged after passing the finish line) Kasia Hutny - swimming coach.

  • Thanks for being so much understanding every day.
  • Thanks for your patience.
  • Thanks for swimming tips. I know I could do better, but we both know that being coached and being in relationship isn‚Äôt easy :)
  • Thanks for founding me a sport nutrition consultation, and support in changing my eating habits
  • Thanks for being great 1-person support team at Ironman Hamburg

She said YES. I become One, and she become One. For each other. üòç #love #engagementring #ironman #trilife #couplesgoals #couple #hamburg #ironmanhamburg #engagement

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Aug 14, 2017 at 12:14am PDT

Others:

MKON - Marcin Konieczny (polish triathlon guru, extremly talented age grouper, Ironman sub 9h, IRONMAN World Championship Hawaii qualifier)

Thanks Marcin for mentoring, and answers to plethora of my questions regarding training, logistic, and races

Miko≈Çaj Luft polish pro triathlete, triathlon coach

Thanks Miko≈Çaj for sharing with me a lot of swim-bike-run tips and tricks during Luft Tri Team camp in Szklarska Porƒôba. It was really productive time.

Damian Witkowski ex pro runner, running coach

Thanks Damian for sharing your deep running knowledgewith me

Jagoda Podkowska sports nutritionist

Thanks Jagoda for helping me eating as I should The provided by you and your team suggestions and menu were easy to apply and just worked! Reduced my weight by feeling even better and more powerfull on the trainings.

item.title: SKITOUR to Prze≈Çƒôcz pod KopƒÖ KondrackƒÖ
item.description:
First guided tour completely out of piste

Last day of our stay in Zakopane we decided to go for a real out of piste skitour, completely beyond the alpine skiing region. We meet with Anka Figura from SKITUROWE TATRY Anna is not only a great talent in the ski mountaineering world, she is also well known in the vertical and ultra running scene. Anna - dynafit athltets bio

#skitour #tatras #tatry #foczenie #skitouring

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 19, 2017 at 9:34am PST

#skitour #tatras #tatry #foczenie

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 19, 2017 at 10:40am PST

üòç#skitour #tatras #tatry #foczenie #skitouring #

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 19, 2017 at 10:06am PST

The peak

Stunning view from the saddle - Prze≈Çƒôcz pod KondrackƒÖ KopƒÖ (1863 meters AMSL)

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 19, 2017 at 9:02am PST

Strava log

Download GPX file

item.title: SKITOUR from Kalat√≥wki via Hala Goryczkowa to Kasprowy Wierch
item.description:
This was our variation based mostly on this tour from: skiturowezakopane.pl (description in polish).

Kalat√≥wki shelter

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 15, 2017 at 3:28am PST

Nice spot to sunshine a bit before or after touring

Hard part of Goryczkowa

The steepest part of tour is in Goryczkowa glade. But don‚Äôt be too much afraid it goes along ski piste, so you are safe.

Kick turns or ‚Ä¶?

It is a bit awkward feeling when crossing your skies with skitour binding while being on 40% vertical uphill. In my opinion it is still the best option to move in mountains in winter. You have just to practice kick turns a lot ;)

Pierwsze koty zakosy. #zakosy #pierwszekotyzaploty #skitour #tatras #tatry #foczenie #gasienicowa

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 17, 2017 at 1:35pm PST

‚Ä¶climb with skies mounted to your backpack

Kasia was afraid of doing kick turns, so she decided to go with skies mounted to her backpack.

It was hard because she was sinking in deep snow and you can get easily exhausted.

#twardzielka #skitouring #skitouringgirl #tatry #tatras #skitour #likeagirl #üíÅ #üí™

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 15, 2017 at 8:49am PST

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 15, 2017 at 9:58am PST

Like a girl

But no doubt she is a hard girl and she was enough determined to reach the summit.

#skitour #tatry #tatras #skitouring #skitouringgirl

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 15, 2017 at 8:49am PST

The peak - Kasprowy Wierch 1987 meters above mean sea level

Time for some nice photos just before sunset and long downhill via Goryczkowa to Ku≈∫nice.

Nie ma to jak zaszczytowac razem przed zachodem s≈Ço≈Ñca üòç #skitoury #skitour #couples #couplesgoals #kasprowy #kasprowywierch

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 15, 2017 at 8:43am PST

Good night!

A post shared by Andi (@andi_triathlon) on Feb 15, 2017 at 3:08pm PST

Strava log

Download GPX file
